alert.note: Alert for Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 7:31AM PST until January 17 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...INCREASING SNOW INTO THE AFTERNOON... .A weather system will spread increasing snow into the region today. The snow will become heavy in the Cascades, eastern third of Washington, and the Idaho Panhandle with snow rates of near an inch per hour expected. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches. * WHERE...Creston, Ritzville, Wilbur, Harrington, Grand Coulee, Odessa, and Coulee City. * WHEN...Until 7 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snow rates of up to 0.5 inches per hour will occur Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
